content.question: Two wires in the same circuit are very close to each other and oriented parallel to one another, with currents traveling in the same direction. Each wire exerts a force on the other wire. Which of the following correctly describes the fundamental cause of these macroscopic forces?

choices.label: The moving charges in each wire create magnetic fields that exert forces on the moving charges in the other wire.
The charges in each wire create electric fields that exert forces on the charges in the other wire.
The atoms in each wire create gravitational fields that exert forces on the atoms in the other wire.
The wires become magnetized by Earthâ€™s magnetic field and exert magnetic forces on each other.

content.answer: The moving charges in each wire create magnetic fields that exert forces on the moving charges in the other wire.
